name: event
title: Event
description: An action that occurs at some location during some time.

fields.name: eventID
fields.description: A unique identifier for an Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: parentEventID
fields.description: An identifier for the broader Event that groups this and potentially other Events.

fields.name: datasetID
fields.description: The identifier for the data set from which the Event record originated.

fields.name: locationID
fields.description: An identifier for the set of location information (data associated with dcterms:Location).
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: protocolID
fields.description: An identifier for the protocol used in this Event.

fields.name: eventType
fields.description: The category that best matches the nature of the Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: eventName
fields.description: A name or code by which the Event is commonly known.

fields.name: recordedBy
fields.description: The Agent who recorded the Event in the field.
fields.examples: `Jos√© E. Crespo`; `Oliver P. Pearson | Anita K. Pearson` (where the value in recordNumber `OPP 7101` corresponds to the collector number for the specimen in the field catalog of Oliver P. Pearson)

fields.name: recordedByID
fields.description: The identifier for the Agent who recorded the Event in the field.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.examples: `https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1825-0097` (for an individual); `https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1825-0097 | https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1825-0098` (for a list of people)

fields.name: fieldNumber
fields.description: An identifier given to the event in the field. Often serves as a link between field notes and the Event.

fields.name: eventDate
fields.description: The date-time or interval during which an Event occurred.
fields.comments: For GatheringEvents, this is the date-time when the gathering took place. Not suitable for recording an Occurrence that does not coincide with the GatheringEvent.
fields.examples: `1963-03-08T14:07-0600` (8 Mar 1963 at 2:07pm in the time zone six hours earlier than UTC); `2009-02-20T08:40Z` (20 February 2009 8:40am UTC); `2018-08-29T15:19` (3:19pm local time on 29 August 2018); `1809-02-12` (some time during 12 February 1809); `1906-06` (some time in June 1906); `1971` (some time in the year 1971); `2007-03-01T13:00:00Z/2008-05-11T15:30:00Z` (some time during the interval between 1 March 2007 1pm UTC and 11 May 2008 3:30pm UTC); `1900/1909` (some time during the interval between the beginning of the year 1900 and the end of the year 1909); `2007-11-13/15` (some time in the interval between 13 November 2007 and 15 November 2007)

fields.name: eventTime
fields.description: The time or interval during which the Event occurred.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a time of day that conforms to ISO 8601-1:2019.
fields.examples: `14:07-0600` (2:07pm in the time zone six hours earlier than UTC); `08:40:21Z` (8:40:21am UTC); `13:00:00Z/15:30:00Z` (the interval between 1pm UTC and 3:30pm UTC)

fields.name: year
fields.description: The four-digit year in which the Event occurred, according to the Common Era Calendar.

fields.name: month
fields.description: The integer month in which the Event occurred.

fields.name: day
fields.description: The integer day of the month on which the Event occurred.

fields.name: verbatimEventDate
fields.description: The verbatim original representation of the date and time information for the GetheringEvent.

fields.name: habitat
fields.description: A category or description of the habitat in which the GatheringEvent occurred.

fields.name: protocolDescription
fields.description: The names of, references to, or descriptions of the methods or protocols used during the Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is describe an Event with no more than one sampling protocol. In the case of a summary Event with multiple protocols, in which a specific protocol can not be attributed to specific child Events, the recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.examples: `UV light trap`; `mist net`; `bottom trawl`; `ad hoc observation | point count`; `Penguins from space: faecal stains reveal the location of emperor penguin colonies, https://doi.org/10.1111/j.1466-8238.2009.00467.x`; `Takats et al. 2001. Guidelines for Nocturnal Owl Monitoring in North America. Beaverhill Bird Observatory and Bird Studies Canada, Edmonton, Alberta. 32 pp., http://www.bsc-eoc.org/download/Owl.pdf`

fields.name: sampleSizeValue
fields.description: A numeric value for a measurement of the size (time duration, length, area, or volume) of a sample in the GatheringEvent.
fields.comments: A sampleSizeValue must have a corresponding sampleSizeUnit.

fields.name: sampleSizeUnit
fields.description: The unit of measurement of the size (time duration, length, area, or volume) of a sample in the GatheringEvent.
fields.comments: A sampleSizeUnit must have a corresponding sampleSizeValue, e.g., `5` for sampleSizeValue with `metre` for sampleSizeUnit.

fields.name: eventEffort
fields.description: The amount of effort expended during the Event.
fields.examples: `40 trap-nights`; `10 observer-hours`; `10 km by foot`; `30 km by car`

fields.name: fieldNotes
fields.description: One of a) an indicator of the existence of, b) a reference to (publication, URI), or c) the text of notes taken in the field about the GatheringEvent.

fields.name: eventCitation
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, bibliographic reference, global unique identifier, URI) of literature associated with the MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `). Note that the ResourceRelationship class is an alternative means of representing associations, and with more detail. Note also that the intended usage of the term dcterms:references in Darwin Core when applied to a MaterialEntity is to point to the definitive source representation of that MaterialEntity if one is available. Note also that the intended usage of dcterms:bibliographicCitation in Darwin Core when applied to a MaterialEntity is to provide the preferred way to cite the MaterialEntity itself.
fields.examples: `http://www.sciencemag.org/cgi/content/abstract/322/5899/261`; `Christopher J. Conroy, Jennifer L. Neuwald. 2008. Phylogeographic study of the California vole, Microtus californicus Journal of Mammalogy, 89(3):755-767.`; `Steven R. Hoofer and Ronald A. Van Den Bussche. 2001. Phylogenetic Relationships of Plecotine Bats and Allies Based on Mitochondrial Ribosomal Sequences. Journal of Mammalogy 82(1):131-137. | Walker, Faith M., Jeffrey T. Foster, Kevin P. Drees, Carol L. Chambers. 2014. Spotted bat (Euderma maculatum) microsatellite discovery using illumina sequencing. Conservation Genetics Resources.`

fields.name: eventRemarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about the Event.
fields.comments: `After the recent rains the river is nearly at flood stage.`

fields.name: higherGeographyID
fields.description: An identifier for the geographic region within which the dcterms:Location occurred.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.examples: `http://vocab.getty.edu/tgn/1002002`  (Ant√°rtida e Islas del Atl√°ntico Sur, Territorio Nacional de la Tierra del Fuego, Argentina).

fields.name: higherGeography
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of geographic names less specific than the information captured in the locality term.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `), with terms in order from least specific to most specific.
fields.examples: `North Atlantic Ocean`; `South America | Argentina | Patagonia | Parque Nacional Nahuel Huapi | Neuqu√©n | Los Lagos` with accompanying values `South America` (continent) `Argentina` (country), `Neuqu√©n` (first order division), and `Los Lagos` (second order division)

fields.name: continent
fields.description: The name of the continent in which the Location occurs.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names. Recommended best practice is to leave this field blank if the Location spans multiple entities at this administrative level or if the Location might be in one or another of multiple possible entities at this level. Multiplicity and uncertainty of the geographic entity can be captured either in the term `higherGeography` or in the term `locality`, or both.

fields.name: waterBody
fields.description: The name of the water body in which the Location occurs.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.

fields.name: islandGroup
fields.description: The name of the island group in which the Location occurs.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.

fields.name: island
fields.description: The name of the island on or near which the Location occurs.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.

fields.name: country
fields.description: The name of the country or major administrative unit in which the Location occurs.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names. Recommended best practice is to leave this field blank if the Location spans multiple entities at this administrative level or if the Location might be in one or another of multiple possible entities at this level. Multiplicity and uncertainty of the geographic entity can be captured either in the term higherGeography or in the term locality, or both.

fields.name: countryCode
fields.description: The standard code for the country in which the Location occurs.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use an ISO 3166-1-alpha-2 country code. Recommended best practice is to leave this field blank if the Location spans multiple entities at this administrative level or if the Location might be in one or another of multiple possible entities at this level. Multiplicity and uncertainty of the geographic entity can be captured either in the term higherGeography or in the term locality, or both.

fields.name: stateProvince
fields.description: The name of the next smaller administrative region than country (state, province, canton, department, region, etc.) in which the Location occurs.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names. Recommended best practice is to leave this field blank if the Location spans multiple entities at this administrative level or if the Location might be in one or another of multiple possible entities at this level. Multiplicity and uncertainty of the geographic entity can be captured either in the term `higherGeography` or in the term `locality`, or both.

fields.name: county
fields.description: The full, unabbreviated name of the next smaller administrative region than stateProvince (county, shire, department, etc.) in which the Location occurs.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names. Recommended best practice is to leave this field blank if the Location spans multiple entities at this administrative level or if the Location might be in one or another of multiple possible entities at this level. Multiplicity and uncertainty of the geographic entity can be captured either in the term `higherGeography` or in the term `locality`, or both.

fields.name: municipality
fields.description: The full, unabbreviated name of the next smaller administrative region than county (city, municipality, etc.) in which the Location occurs. Do not use this term for a nearby named place that does not contain the actual location.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names. Recommended best practice is to leave this field blank if the Location spans multiple entities at this administrative level or if the Location might be in one or another of multiple possible entities at this level. Multiplicity and uncertainty of the geographic entity can be captured either in the term `higherGeography` or in the term `locality`, or both.

fields.name: locality
fields.description: The specific description of the place.
fields.comments: Less specific geographic information can be provided in other geographic terms (higherGeography, continent, country, stateProvince, county, municipality, waterBody, island, islandGroup). This term may contain information modified from the original to correct perceived errors or standardize the description.
fields.examples: `Bariloche, 25 km NNE via Ruta Nacional 40 (=Ruta 237)`; `Queets Rainforest, Olympic National Park`

fields.name: verbatimLocality
fields.description: The original textual description of the Location of the GatheringEvent.
fields.examples: `25 km NNE Bariloche por R. Nac. 237`

fields.name: minimumElevationInMeters
fields.description: The lower limit of the range of elevation (altitude, usually above sea level), in meters.

fields.name: maximumElevationInMeters
fields.description: The upper limit of the range of elevation (altitude, usually above sea level), in meters.

fields.name: verbatimElevation
fields.description: The original description of the elevation (altitude, usually above sea level) of the Location.

fields.name: minimumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters
fields.description: The lesser distance in a range of distance from a reference surface in the vertical direction, in meters. Use positive values for locations above the surface, negative values for locations below. If depth measures are given, the reference surface is the location given by the depth, otherwise the reference surface is the location given by the elevation.
fields.examples: `-1.5` (below the surface); `4.2` (above the surface); For a 1.5 meter sediment core from the bottom of a lake (at depth 20m) at 300m elevation: verbatimElevation: `300m` minimumElevationInMeters: `300`, maximumElevationInMeters: `300`, verbatimDepth: `20m`, minimumDepthInMeters: `20`, maximumDepthInMeters: `20`, minimumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters: `0`, maximumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters: `-1.5`.

fields.name: maximumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters
fields.description: The greater distance in a range of distance from a reference surface in the vertical direction, in meters. Use positive values for locations above the surface, negative values for locations below. If depth measures are given, the reference surface is the location given by the depth, otherwise the reference surface is the location given by the elevation.
fields.examples: `-1.5` (below the surface); `4.2` (above the surface); For a 1.5 meter sediment core from the bottom of a lake (at depth 20m) at 300m elevation: verbatimElevation: `300m` minimumElevationInMeters: `300`, maximumElevationInMeters: `300`, verbatimDepth: `20m`, minimumDepthInMeters: `20`, maximumDepthInMeters: `20`, minimumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters: `0`, maximumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters: `-1.5`.

fields.name: minimumDepthInMeters
fields.description: The lesser depth of a range of depth below the local surface, in meters.

fields.name: maximumDepthInMeters
fields.description: The greater depth of a range of depth below the local surface, in meters.

fields.name: verbatimDepth
fields.description: The original description of the depth below the local surface.

fields.name: verticalDatum
fields.description: The vertical datum used as the reference upon which the values in the elevation terms are based.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: locationAccordingTo
fields.description: Information about the source of this Location information. Could be a publication (gazetteer), institution, or team of individuals.

fields.name: locationRemarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about the Location.

fields.name: decimalLatitude
fields.description: The geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a Location.
fields.comments: Positive values are north of the Equator, negative values are south of it. Legal values lie between -90 and 90, inclusive.

fields.name: decimalLongitude
fields.description: The geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a Location.
fields.comments: Positive values are east of the Greenwich Meridian, negative values are west of it. Legal values lie between -180 and 180, inclusive.

fields.name: geodeticDatum
fields.description: The ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference system (SRS) upon which the geographic coordinates given in decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude as based.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use the EPSG code of the SRS, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the geodetic datum, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the ellipsoid, if known. If none of these is known, use the value `unknown`.

fields.name: coordinateUncertaintyInMeters
fields.description: The horizontal distance (in meters) from the given decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude describing the smallest circle containing the whole of the Location.
fields.comments: Leave the value empty if the uncertainty is unknown, cannot be estimated, or is not applicable (because there are no coordinates). Zero is not a valid value for this term.
fields.examples: `30` (reasonable lower limit on or after 2000-05-01 of a GPS reading under good conditions if the actual precision was not recorded at the time); `100` (reasonable lower limit before 2000-05-01 of a GPS reading under good conditions if the actual precision was not recorded at the time); `71` (uncertainty for a UTM coordinate having 100 meter precision and a known spatial reference system)

fields.name: coordinatePrecision
fields.description: A decimal representation of the precision of the coordinates given in the decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude.
fields.examples: `0.00001` (normal GPS limit for decimal degrees); `0.000278` (nearest second); `0.01667` (nearest minute); `1.0` (nearest degree)

fields.name: pointRadiusSpatialFit
fields.description: The ratio of the area of the point-radius (decimalLatitude, decimalLongitude, coordinateUncertaintyInMeters) to the area of the true (original, or most specific) spatial representation of the Location.
fields.comments: Legal values are 0, greater than or equal to 1, or undefined. A value of 1 is an exact match or 100% overlap. A value of 0 should be used if the given point-radius does not completely contain the original representation. The pointRadiusSpatialFit is undefined (and should be left empty) if the original representation is any geometry without area (e.g., a point or polyline) and without uncertainty and the given georeference is not that same geometry (without uncertainty). If both the original and the given georeference are the same point, the pointRadiusSpatialFit is 1. Detailed explanations with graphical examples can be found in the Georeferencing Best Practices, Chapman and Wieczorek, 2020 (https://doi.org/10.15468/doc-gg7h-s853).

fields.name: verbatimCoordinates
fields.description: The verbatim original spatial coordinates of the Location.
fields.comments: The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in verbatimCoordinateSystem.

fields.name: verbatimLatitude
fields.description: The verbatim original latitude of the Location.
fields.comments: The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in verbatimCoordinateSystem.

fields.name: verbatimLongitude
fields.description: The verbatim original longitude of the Location.
fields.comments: The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in verbatimCoordinateSystem.

fields.name: verbatimCoordinateSystem
fields.description: The coordinate format for the verbatimLatitude and verbatimLongitude or the verbatimCoordinates of the Location.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: verbatimSRS
fields.description: The ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference system (SRS) upon which coordinates given in verbatimLatitude and verbatimLongitude, or verbatimCoordinates are based.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use the EPSG code of the SRS, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the geodetic datum, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the ellipsoid, if known. If none of these is known, use the value `unknown`.

fields.name: footprintWKT
fields.description: A Well-Known Text (WKT) representation of the shape (footprint, geometry) that defines the Location.
fields.comments: A Location may have both a point-radius representation (see decimalLatitude) and a footprint representation, and they may differ from each other.
fields.examples: `POLYGON ((10 20, 11 20, 11 21, 10 21, 10 20))` (the one-degree bounding box with opposite corners at longitude=10, latitude=20 and longitude=11, latitude=21)

fields.name: footprintSRS
fields.description: The ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference system (SRS) upon which the geometry given in footprintWKT is based.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use the EPSG code of the SRS, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the geodetic datum, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the ellipsoid, if known. If none of these is known, use the value `unknown`. It is also permitted to provide the SRS in Well-Known-Text, especially if no EPSG code provides the necessary values for the attributes of the SRS. Do not use this term to describe the SRS of the decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude, nor of any verbatim coordinates - use the geodeticDatum and verbatimSRS instead.
fields.examples: `epsg:4326`; `GEOGCS['GCS_WGS_1984', DATUM['D_WGS_1984', SPHEROID['WGS_1984',6378137,298.257223563]], PRIMEM['Greenwich',0], UNIT['Degree',0.0174532925199433]]` (WKT for the standard WGS84 Spatial Reference System EPSG:4326)

fields.name: footprintSpatialFit
fields.description: The ratio of the area of the footprint (footprintWKT) to the area of the true (original, or most specific) spatial representation of the Location.
fields.comments: Legal values are 0, greater than or equal to 1, or undefined. A value of 1 is an exact match or 100% overlap. A value of 0 should be used if the given footprint does not completely contain the original representation. The footprintSpatialFit is undefined (and should be left empty) if the original representation is any geometry without area (e.g., a point or polyline) and without uncertainty and the given georeference is not that same geometry (without uncertainty). If both the original and the given georeference are the same point, the footprintSpatialFit is 1.

fields.name: georeferencedBy
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who determined the georeference (spatial representation) for the Location.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).

fields.name: georeferencedDate
fields.description: The date on which the Location was georeferenced.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a date that conforms to ISO 8601-1:2019.

fields.name: georeferenceProtocol
fields.description: A description or reference to the methods used to determine the spatial footprint, coordinates, and uncertainties.
fields.examples: `Georeferencing Quick Reference Guide (Zermoglio et al. 2020, https://doi.org/10.35035/e09p-h128)`

fields.name: georeferenceSources
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of maps, gazetteers, or other resources used to georeference the Location, described specifically enough to allow anyone in the future to use the same resources.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.examples: `https://www.geonames.org/`; `USGS 1:24000 Florence Montana Quad 1967 | Terrametrics 2008 on Google Earth`; `GeoLocate`

fields.name: georeferenceRemarks
fields.description: Notes or comments about the spatial description determination, explaining assumptions made in addition or opposition to the those formalized in the method referred to in georeferenceProtocol.

fields.name: preferredSpatialRepresentation
fields.description: An indication of which spatial representation (point-radius or footprint) is preferred.
